Silver Wire Jewelry

Hey there! Are you the type of person that wants to spend less? And yet wants to wear some classy jewelry. Then let me help you make one.

Usually http://www.thoughts.com/calvinmelend1127/wholesale-silver-jewelry contains one of the most popular metals for wire artists and wire jewelry makers to work with. There are many reasons for this, it provides the maker with a combination of a cheap material that is acquiescent and has pleasing visual effects. Silver is an excellent background to beads and gemstones, helping to show off the rich color of the materials used. Many beautiful items of jewelry are made using little more than silver wire and beads.

Enough of all the chit-chat and definitions. Here are the instructions in making one. First is that you must buy or make a wire wrapping jig. Pre-made jigs have removable pegs with a peg board, making you to produce a variety of wire shapes and sizes. Hand-made jigs can be constructed easily by hammering small nails into a portion of wood in whatever shape you desire. Second step is that you look for wire between 20 gauge and 24 gauge in thickness for the best flexibility. (If the gauge is high the thinner the wire.) Third step is cut an extent of silver wire with your metal scissors; you can trim the excess if your wire is too long. Use the wire wrapping jig to bend your wire into attractive shapes. Twist and loop the silver wire around the jig pegs to create http://quizilla.teennick.com/stories/21945811/wholesale-silver-jewelry flower shapes and scrolls. Repeat this process to create several matching shapes for your piece, do whatever shape that pleases you.

For the fourth step, link your made wire design components all together now. Grip a jump ring with the chain-nosed pliers somewhat to one side of the opening slowly, and then twist the ring wide or slightly open. Thread the ends of two of your wire components all the way through the jump ring, and twist it shut with the chain-nosed pliers. Do the process again until all of your wire shapes/designs are linked together in a flexible chain. The last step is attaching a clasp to one end of your linked chain of wire components with a jump ring. Then twist open the jump ring cautiously to avoid any deviations or stress onto the metal. Thread the open ring through the wire component and the small loop on the end of the clasp, and close it with your pliers. Attach a jump ring to the opposite end of the piece for fastening the clasp. And that’s it. Just add some more designs if you want. You can even add some beads or anything that what comes in to your mind, as long as it’s fashionable and comfy to wear and to show off.

Oh and by the way, while making this silver wire jewelry always wear safety glasses whenever you cut wire to protect your eyes. So that’s it, instead of buying some expensive jewelry, why not make one and have fun.

Gathering Classic Silver Jewelry

Imagine if these two jewelries you have would have been vintage sterling silver jewelries, it’s like owning a piece of the moon yourself. The fact that in ancient times, silver is associated with the crescent moon, it has already cemented its reputation as one of the most beautiful and sought after “must-haves” in our possession. Though silver before now had eye-catching features, it is still very comfortable to have one due to that it has been present since the earliest eras and provided an indistinguishable backdrop in nearly all festivities and other social events.

Usually, silver is partnered with other metals and are formed to alloys due to that pure silver which is 99.9% is too malleable to produce purposeful objects. Sterling silver, classified as the standard silver, is an alloy composed of 92.5% silver and with 7.5% copper. Some http://www.avilasterling.com/wholesale-silver-jewelry.html are coated with 99.9% pure silver as to prevent corrosion since copper reacts to the oxygen in the air. It has been agreed upon that sterling silver originated in Europe and has been around as early as the 12th century in a location we call now modern Northern Germany and was mainly used for trade. Silver has been an expensive metal before the 15th century, but because of the huge find of silver deposits in the New World, it has depreciated drastically since then.

Because of the lowered prices of silver, increased interest in its use has been developed especially in jewelry. An example is that due to the economic crisis and tough financial times, being engaged is very expensive, mainly that diamond rings are high-priced. However, because of the enhanced quality of making http://www.avilasterling.com/ecommerce/ , couples can once more manage to pay for a good engagement or wedding ring.

There are tips to follow if you want to own a genuine piece of silver jewelry. Nowadays, hallmarking is done for buyers to identify the; 1) the purity of the item, 2) the company or the silversmith who made the item, 3) and date and location of the manufacturer or trader. If the item is sterling silver, make sure that you identify its mark because every item is required to have one. If you don’t find any stamp, don’t judge immediately because it might be an antique and was made way before hallmarking was even established. Make sure that it is genuine by letting it be checked by an authentic antique silver dealer.

As sterling silver ages, it naturally darkens and forms what they call “patina” which, in fact, very desirable for the owner due to that it shows the great workmanship in jewelry. It usually forms in the engraved parts of the jewelry which are darker while the exterior parts are glossy. Majority of the collectors favored patina that developed through wear and tear than that of latest glimmering silver ones.

Cleaning vintage sterling silver jewelry is important because it maintains the gleaming shine of the item which displays its lustrous worth. Do not use strong solutions as it will diminish the patina that developed through wear, especially in the engraved portion. Only mildly rub the surface of the jewelry so that it maintains its polished sterling look.
